maml:description.maml:para: Used to ask user if he wants to run script
In addition to prompt, execution context is shown. Asking for approval helps to let run master script and only execute specific scripts, thus loading only needed rules.

maml:Description.maml:para: {{ Fill Default Description }}
Title of the prompt

command:parameter.maml:name: Question

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompt question

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Do you want to run this script?

command:parameter.maml:name: Accept

maml:Description.maml:para: {{ Fill Accept Description }}

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Continue with only the next step of the operation

command:parameter.maml:name: Deny

maml:Description.maml:para: {{ Fill Deny Description }}

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Skip this operation and proceed with the next operation

maml:Description.maml:para: {{ Fill Default Description }}
Title of the prompt

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Do you want to run this script?

command:parameter.maml:name: Accept

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Continue with only the next step of the operation

command:parameter.maml:name: Deny

maml:Description.maml:para: {{ Fill Deny Description }}

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Skip this operation and proceed with the next operation

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Approve-Execute
None. true if user wants to continue, false otherwise

maml:description.maml:para: Verify file is correctly encoded
Confirm-FileEncoding verifies target file is encoded as expected. Wrong encoding may return bad data resulting is unexpected behavior

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to the file which to check
Expected encoding
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Path to the file which to check
Expected encoding
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: [string[]] One or more paths to file to check

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Convert-SDDLToACL

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the encoding of a file
Gets the encoding of a file, if the encoding can't be determined, ex. the file contains unicode charaters but no BOM, then by default UTF-8 is assumed.

maml:Description.maml:para: The path of the file to get the encoding of
Default encoding for non ASCII files. The default is set by global variable, UTF8 no BOM for Core or UTF8 with BOM for Desktop edition
The path of the file to get the encoding of
Default encoding for non ASCII files. The default is set by global variable, UTF8 no BOM for Core or UTF8 with BOM for Desktop edition

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-FileEncoding

maml:description.maml:para: Scan all scripts in this repository and get windows service names involved in rules
{{ Fill in the Description }}

maml:Description.maml:para: Root folder name which to scan recursively
Root folder name which to scan recursively

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-NetworkService
None, File with the list of services is made

maml:description.maml:para: Run process and capture output
Run process with or without arguments, set wait time and capture output. If the target process results in an error, error message is formatted and shown in addition to standard output if any.

maml:Description.maml:para: The application or document to start
A collection of command-line arguments to use when starting the application
Number of milliseconds to wait for the associated process to exit Default is 0, which means wait indefinitely
Whether to use the operating system shell to start the process
If specified formats standard output into INFO messages
The application or document to start
A collection of command-line arguments to use when starting the application
Whether to use the operating system shell to start the process
Number of milliseconds to wait for the associated process to exit Default is 0, which means wait indefinitely
If specified formats standard output into INFO messages

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-ProcessOutput

maml:description.maml:para: Returns .NET return type name for input object
Unlike Get-Member commandlet returns only type name, and if there are multiple type names chooses unique ones only.

maml:Description.maml:para: Target object for which to retrieve type name
Target object for which to retrieve type name

maml:alert.maml:para: Original code link: https://github.com/gravejester/Communary.PASM TODO: need better checking for input, on pipeline.
Modifications by metablaster year 2020: Added check when object is null Added comment based help Removed unneeded parentheses Added input type to parameter

maml:description.maml:para: Set network profile for physical network interfaces
Set network profile for each physical/hardware network interfaces Recommended is 'Public' profile for maximum security, unless 'Private' is needed

maml:description.maml:para: Set vertical screen buffer to recommended value
In some cases, depending on project settings a user might need larger buffer to preserve all the output in the console for review and scroll back.

maml:description.maml:para: Update context for Approve-Execute function
Execution context is shown in the console every time Approve-Execute is called. It helps to know the state and progress of execution.

maml:Description.maml:para: First context string before . (dot)
Second context string after . (dot)
Additional string after -> (arrow)
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
